thread.title: Muhammad Ali tweets support for Louisville during escort scandal
thread.title_full: Muhammad Ali tweets support for Louisville during escort scandal

title: Muhammad Ali tweets support for Louisville during escort scandal
text:
Muhammad Ali tweets support for Louisville during escort scandal 
Muhammad Ali is standing behind the Louisville Cardinals despite the allegations. Yardbarker Oct 22, 2015 at 10:40p ET 0Shares 
LOUISVILLE, Ky. -- Muhammad Ali has tweeted support for the University of Louisville and basketball coach Rick Pitino despite a scandal in which an escort alleged in a book that former Cardinals staffer Andre McGee hired her and other dancers to strip and have sex with recruits and players. 
The three-time champion and Louisville native posted comments from his fan and personal Twitter accounts Thursday evening that said, true From one champion to another, I will always stand behind & support @GoCards . Go Cards! #UniteLouisville #AliTweet pic.twitter.com/oTtjof0sQC â€” Muhammad Ali (@MuhammadAli) October 23, 2015 
The tweets did not reference the allegations that have led to four separate investigations. 
The 73-year-old boxing great received the Grawemeyer Spirit Award from the school last month for helping inspire others, and he occasionally attends Cardinals football games. His son, Assad, played baseball at Louisville. 0
